item.title: Emily add a quote by Bernard M. Baruch
item.description: "Be who you are and say what you feel, because those who mind don't matter, and those who matter don't mind." -- Bernard M. Baruch

item.title: Emily add a quote by Eleanor Roosevelt
item.description: "No one can make you feel inferior without your consent." -- Eleanor Roosevelt

item.title: Emily add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "Outside of a dog, a book is man's best friend. Inside of a dog it's too dark to read." -- Groucho Marx

item.title: Emily add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "The fool doth think he is wise, but the wise man knows himself to be a fool." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Emily add a quote by Maurice Switzer
item.description: "It is better to remain silent at the risk of being thought a fool, than to talk and remove all doubt of it." -- Maurice Switzer

item.title: Emily add a quote by Miss Piggy
item.description: "Beauty is in the eye of the beholder and it may be necessary from time to time to give a stupid or misinformed beholder a black eye." -- Miss Piggy

item.title: Emily add a quote by Steve Martin
item.description: "A day without sunshine is like, you know, night." -- Steve Martin

item.title: Emily add a quote by Bill Watterson
item.description: "Hold it. You know what I'd like to see? I'd like to see the three bears eat the three little pigs, and then the bears join up with the big bad wolf and eat Goldilocks and Little Red Riding Hood! Tell me a story like that, OK?" -- Bill Watterson

item.title: Emily add a quote by Bill Watterson
item.description: "Hello Dad! It is now three in the morning. Do you know where I am? " -- Bill Watterson

item.title: Emily add a quote by Bill Watterson
item.description: "As far as I'm concerned, if something is so complicated that you can't explain it in 10 seconds, then it's probably not worth knowing anyway." -- Bill Watterson

item.title: Emily add a quote by Bill Watterson
item.description: "The surest sign that intelligent life exists elsewhere in the universe is that it has never tried to contact us." -- Bill Watterson

item.title: Emily add a quote by Bill Watterson
item.description: "Hobbes: Do you think there's a God? Calvin: Well, somebody's out to get me!" -- Bill Watterson

item.title: Emily add a quote by Bill Watterson
item.description: "Hey Susie Derkins, is that your face, or is a 'possum stuck in your collar?" -- Bill Watterson

item.title: Emily add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "The person, be it gentleman or lady, who has not pleasure in a good novel, must be intolerably stupid." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Emily add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "I do not want people to be very agreeable, as it saves me the trouble of liking them a great deal." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Emily add a quote by Cath Crowley
item.description: "I liked that he had hair that was growing without a plan. A grin that came out of nowhere and left the same way." -- Cath Crowley

item.title: Emily add a quote by Steph Bowe
item.description: "Sometimes the hardest person in the world to talk to is your best friend, because it matters so much." -- Steph Bowe

item.title: Emily add a quote by Cath Crowley
item.description: "I guess love's kind of like a marshmallow in a microwave on high. After it explodes it's still a marshmallow. but, you know, now it's a complicated marshmallow." -- Cath Crowley

item.title: Emily add a quote by Rainbow Rowell
item.description: "I want everyone to meet you. You're my favorite person of all time." -- Rainbow Rowell
